results.title: Turn the soil
results.creator_credit: Australian National Film Board and John Heyer
results.brief_description: This film traces the story of the development of the Australian wheat industry from the days when the first Ridley machine was taken into the crops at harvest time. It shows what scientific research and experimentation are doing today to help the wheat farmer combat rust, low rainfall, wind, weeds, and other pests, and to develop strains of wheat which mature well in spite of adverse climactic conditions.

results.title: Turn of the tide. The Man at the gate
results.creator_credit: British National Films GHW Productions, John Corfield, J. Arthur Rank, Lady Yule and Norman Walker
results.brief_description: Turn of the tide (80 min): This rarely seen British film, based on the novel ‘Three fevers’ by Leo Walmsley, was filmed on location at Robin Hood’s Bay and Whitby and tells the story of rivalry between two fishing families. It is set in the dramatically beautiful countryside of the Yorkshire coast. “The Man at the gate” (48 min): In 1940 Norman Walker put on his sea boots yet again and sent his location team down to Cornwall to shoot exteriors for a film which might have been regarded as a sequel. The story is centred around a fishing family, headed by Wilfrid Lawson.

results.title: Turn of the century
results.brief_description: A glance at Canada’s yesteryears, at people and events, fashions and foibles at the end of the 19th century and the beginning of the 20th. From old photos and fragments of silent movies, this film pieces together a lively chronicle of what our elders like to call “the good old days.”

results.title: Turn a handle, flick a switch. - 2nd rev. ed.
results.brief_description: Shows how basic domestic services, such as gas, electricity and water are provided. Deals with the source of these services, their reticulation and home usage. The program ends with a strong conservation message - “turn off the light, etc.” Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Turkey: the bridge
results.creator_credit: Samaratin Films, British Petroleum and Derek Williams
results.brief_description: Traces the history of Turkey - the land bridge between Europe and Asia. For more than 3,000 years the great events of these two continents centred on Turkey. The remains of the Greek civilisation, the crusades, and ancient Constantinople are contrasted with scenes of modern Istanbul.

results.title: Turkey: nation in transition
results.creator_credit: International Film Foundation, Julien Bryan and Leroy Leatherman
results.brief_description: Introductory animation reviews the history of Turkey and the Middle East from earliest civilization to the twentieth century. Documentary footage shows life in Turkey today, its political and economic problems and its development as a modern nation with democratic institutions.

results.title: Turkey: emergence of a modern nation
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Clifford J. Kamen
results.brief_description: Reviews the major political and social developments in the Republic of Turkey since its formation in 1923, and shows the influence of cultural traditions dating back to the Greek, Roman and Ottoman empires. Uses map animation to show the relationship between the nation’s geographic position and its strategic position in world affairs. Illustrates the efforts of the Turkish government and people to build a modern, independent industrial nation.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Clifford J. Kamen

results.title: Turkey: a strategic land and it's people
results.brief_description: The location of Turkey between Asia and Europe and astride Russia’s water route to the Black Sea gives it a strategic political importance. Shows the climatic and geographical features, natural resources and industries in relation to the Turkish people, the beginnings of westernisation as introduced by Ataturk and the continuing changes taking place in modern Turkey.

results.title: Turkey shoot
results.creator_credit: Filmco, Antony Ginnane, William Fayman and Brian Trenchard-Smith
results.brief_description: Set in 1995 where criminals are hunted in controlled environments. There is no room for individuality and anyone who dares to be different is thrown into a detention camp for brainwashing where they are tortured and become candidates for manhunts. Cast includes Steve Railsback, Olivia Hussey, Michael Craig and Carmen Duncan.
